erpSync.title: ERP Sync
erpSync.description: Sync data between Eryxon MES and your external ERP system
erpSync.unifiedEndpointDesc: Optimized bulk sync with change detection
erpSync.previewChangesDesc: Check what would change without making modifications
erpSync.executeSyncDesc: Sync jobs, parts, and resources in a single request

features.changeDetectionDesc: Skip unchanged records via sync_hash comparison
features.batchOperationsDesc: Sync multiple entities in a single request
features.webhookEventsDesc: Automatic webhook dispatch on sync completion

options.continueOnErrorDesc: Continue syncing if an error occurs

webhooks.webhooksDescription: Configure webhooks to receive real-time notifications
webhooks.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this webhook?

apiDocsPage.title: Eryxon Flow API
apiDocsPage.description: Production workflow management API for custom metals fabrication. Build integrations, automate workflows, and manage your production data programmatically.
apiDocsPage.openApiSpecDesc: Download the spec to use with Swagger, Postman, or generate client SDKs
apiDocsPage.gettingStartedDesc: Start making API calls in minutes with this beginner-friendly guide
apiDocsPage.step1Desc: Navigate to Admin > API Keys in the web interface and generate a new API key.
apiDocsPage.keepApiKeySecureDesc: Your API key is shown only once. Store it securely and never commit it to version control.
apiDocsPage.step2Desc: Make your first API call to verify your key works. We recommend starting with the read-only
apiDocsPage.step3Desc: Explore the API Reference below to see all available endpoints and try them interactively.
apiDocsPage.codeExamplesDesc: Ready-to-use code snippets in multiple programming languages
apiDocsPage.authDesc: All API requests require authentication using an API key in the Authorization header:
apiDocsPage.rateLimitingDesc: API requests are rate-limited. Check the X-RateLimit-* headers in responses for current limits and usage.
apiDocsPage.interactiveTestingDesc: Test API endpoints directly in your browser. No additional tools required!
apiDocsPage.howToTestStep1: Click the "Authorize" button below (green lock icon)
apiDocsPage.howToTestStep3: Expand any endpoint and click "Try it out"
apiDocsPage.stagesEndpointDesc: Best endpoint to test your API key. Returns all production stages.
apiDocsPage.jobsGetEndpointDesc: List all jobs with filtering. Test pagination with limit/offset.
apiDocsPage.jobsPostEndpointDesc: Create a new job. Includes example request body.
apiDocsPage.jobsSyncEndpointDesc: ERP sync endpoint. Upsert by external_id.
apiDocsPage.completeApiReferenceDesc: Full OpenAPI specification with all endpoints, schemas, and examples.

dataImport.dropzoneText: Drag and drop your CSV file here, or click to browse
dataImport.dragDrop: Drag and drop your CSV file here, or click to browse
dataImport.requiredFieldsMissingDescription: Please map all required fields before continuing
dataImport.previewDescription: Showing first 5 rows of {{count}} records to import
dataImport.existingUpdated: Records with matching external_id will be updated
dataImport.pleaseWait: Please wait while your data is being imported...
dataImport.noValidRecordsDescription: Please fix the validation errors and try again

mqtt.title: MQTT Publishers
mqtt.description: Configure MQTT brokers to receive real-time event streams using the Unified Namespace (UNS) pattern
mqtt.configurePublisher: Configure your MQTT broker connection and topic settings
mqtt.publishersDescription: MQTT brokers configured to receive real-time events from your manufacturing operations
mqtt.noPublishers: No MQTT publishers configured yet. Add a publisher to start streaming events.
mqtt.topicPatternHelp: Use variables like {enterprise}, {site}, {area}, {cell}, {event} to build your topic hierarchy
mqtt.name: Name
mqtt.selectAtLeastOne: Please select at least one event
mqtt.noLogs: No publish logs yet. Events will appear here once published.
mqtt.unsDescription: ISA-95 compliant topic hierarchy for manufacturing
mqtt.howToSetup: How to connect your MQTT broker and subscribe to events
mqtt.brokersDescription: Any MQTT broker with HTTP publish API support works. Popular options include:
mqtt.hivemqDesc: Managed MQTT cloud with HTTP API
mqtt.emqxDesc: High-performance MQTT broker with REST API
mqtt.unsPatternDescription: Topics follow the ISA-95 hierarchy: Enterprise > Site > Area > Cell > Event
mqtt.practice2: Keep credentials secure - use environment variables
mqtt.practice3: Subscribe to specific topics to reduce message volume
mqtt.practice4: Implement reconnection logic in your clients
mqtt.practice5: Use QoS 1 or 2 for critical events
mqtt.jobCreatedDesc: When a new job is created
mqtt.jobStartedDesc: When a job changes to in_progress
mqtt.jobCompletedDesc: When a job is marked complete
mqtt.opStartedDesc: When an operator starts an operation
mqtt.opResumedDesc: When a paused operation is resumed
mqtt.opCompletedDesc: When an operation is marked complete
mqtt.issueCreatedDesc: When a quality issue is reported

mcp.enterName: Please enter a name for the endpoint

mcp.step3Description: Your AI can now access your manufacturing data
